intro: Ellisia torreyi var. orcuttii, commonly known as the Orcutt's ellisia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, often found in woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
